Name: Amplified Risk
Details:
When you force a creature to make a saving throw, if they roll a 1 on the d20, the following applicable effects activate: 
- If a target has immunity to the damage type, they take damage as though they only had resistance 
- If a target has resistance to the damage type, they take damage as though they do not have resistance 
- The duration is doubled 
- If subsequent checks are required, they are made with disadvantage
Source: Creed's Codex: Arcane Secrets of the Summoners
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Arcane Convergence
Details: When you cast a spell of 1st through 8th level, you can choose to tap into the power of convergence. This allows you to gain the effects of the spell as though it was cast one level higher. You must then roll on the convergence table to determine your mental accuracy. You regain the use of this ability once you’ve completed a short or long rest.
Source: Creed's Codex: Arcane Secrets of the Summoners
Prerequisite: Spellcasting or Pact Magic Feature,Character level 4
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Augment Adept
Details:
Working through the complex formulae, you learn one force augment option of your choice from the summoner class. If required, your spellcasting ability for the augment is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat). If the augment has a prerequisite of any kind, you can select that augment only if you’re a summoner who meets the prerequisite.
Whenever you gain a level, you can replace the augment with another one from the summoner class.
Source: Creed's Codex: Arcane Secrets of the Summoners
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Child of chaos
Details: After every long rest, your body undergoes a random transformation. Roll a d6 and undergo the change detailed on the table, which lasts until you complete a long rest. This change can raise your ability scores above 20.
Source: Creed's Codex: Arcane Secrets of the Summoners
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Death Defiant
Details:
You refuse to pass quietly into the void and have undergone a dark ritual.
- You make death saving throws with advantage.
- If you die from a cause other than old age, your shadow gains a semblance of your sentience and the statistics of a shadow, which you control on your turn. It lasts until it drops to 0 hit points, it reduces a hostile creature to 0 hit points, or 1 minute has passed. If you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points that is small or larger, the shadow acts as a conduit, siphoning the slain creature’s life force, returning you to life with 1 hit point, and your shadow reverts to its previous state. You do not have any missing body parts restored. You are incapacitated until the beginning of your next turn. The shadow has additional hit points equal to twice your level, and its attack and damage rolls gain an additional modifier equal to your proficiency bonus. Once you use this feature, you must finish 1d4 long rests before you can use it again.
Source: Creed's Codex: Arcane Secrets of the Summoners
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Fervent Belief
Details:
With a heart full of unwavering devotion and a spirit aflame with conviction, you offer healing to your allies and retribution to those who stand against you.
- Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20.
- Once per round when you heal a creature with a spell, racial, or class feature, you can chastise one creature you can see within 60 feet. The target takes radiant or necrotic damage (your choice) equal to your level.
Source: Creed's Codex: Arcane Secrets of the Summoners
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Dual Specialty
Details:
You have split your focus, pursuing your martial prowess and spellcasting capabilities. 
- When you take damage, you can use your reaction to infuse your body with magic negating damage from the triggering attack equal to your proficiency bonus. 
- When you make a damage roll, you can use your reaction to combine your arcane skill with physical capability to deal additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus.
Source: Creed's Codex: Arcane Secrets of the Summoners
Prerequisite options: At least 3 levels in a class that gains access to 9th level spells and at least 3 levels in a class that does not.
Prerequisite: At least 3 levels in a class that gains access to 9th level spells and at least 3 levels in a class that does not.
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Juggernaut
Details: You are extremely difficult to control. You have advantage on any saves or checks to resist becoming blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, grappled, incapacitated, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, stunned, or unconscious.
Source: Creed's Codex: Arcane Secrets of the Summoners
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Martial convergence
Details: When you take the attack action on your turn, you can choose to tap into the Power of Convergence for one additional weapon attack. You must then roll on the convergence table to determine your mental accuracy. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.
Source: Creed's Codex: Arcane Secrets of the Summoners
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Relic Hunter
Details:
You have devoted substantial time to the pursuit of lost artifacts, ancient secrets, and the mysterious resting place of relics lost to time. 
- Increase your Intelligence or Wisdom score by 1, to a maximum of 20.  
- Any checks made in relation to finding treasure you make with advantage. 
- With 8 hours of work and access to appropriate materials, you can decipher information related to a lost relic. For example, you may have uncovered the next clue in a series, found an obscure reverence in a text referring to a magical item, or similar information provided by the GM.
Source: Creed's Codex: Arcane Secrets of the Summoners
Ability Score Increase: Wisdom

Name: Summoner Bond
Details:
You and your summon are two halves of a whole. You exude confidence while interacting with your summon: 
- Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- You gain a +1 to skill checks of the chosen ability score while you have a summoned creature.
Source: Creed's Codex: Arcane Secrets of the Summoners
Ability Score Increase: Ability of your choice

Name: Touch of Convergence
Details:
You have been transformed by the power of convergence, gaining the following benefits: 
- Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- You learn the Monstrous Transformation spell and one Conjuration or Transmutation 1st-level spell of your choice. You can cast each spell gained by this feat once, refreshing upon a long rest. If you have access to spell slots, you can also use slots of the appropriate level to cast these spells. The spellcasting ability for these spells is the ability increased by the feat. 
- Whenever you cast a conjuration or transmutation spell, you can choose to roll on the table of convergence.
Source: Creed's Codex: Arcane Secrets of the Summoners
Ability Score Increase: Intelligence,Wisdom,Charisma

Name: Armored Mobility
Details:
You have trained under grueling conditions in your armor and have become more adapted to the weight, bulk, and feel.
- Increase your Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
- Your speed increases by 5 feet.
- You have advantage on checks to avoid exhaustion due to physical exertion.
Source: Magic Items & Exotic Equipment
Ability Score Increase: Strength,Dexterity,Constitution

Name: Exotic Equipment Proficiency
Details:
You have trained to master the use of exotic equipment.
Your existing armor and weapon proficiencies now extend to exotic equipment of the same type.
Source: Creed's Codex: Arcane Secrets of the Summoners,Magic Items & Exotic Equipment
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Feint Master
Details:
Your skill with a weapon, whether your body or equipment, can throw off opponents or distract them from your true intentions.
- Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
- Once per turn, when you take the attack action, you can make a Strength or Dexterity (Performance) check contested by your target’s Wisdom (Insight) check. If you succeed, you have advantage on your first attack against the target.
Source: Magic Items & Exotic Equipment
Ability Score Increase: Strength,Dexterity

Name: Grappler
Details:
You’ve developed the skills necessary to hold your own in close-quarters grappling. You gain the following benefits:
- You have advantage on attack rolls against a creature you are grappling.
- You can use your action to try to pin a creature grappled by you. To do so, make another grapple check. If you succeed, you and the creature are both restrained until the grapple ends.
Source: SRD
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Amplification Adept
Details: You learn one Amplification option of your choice from the psion class. Your ability for the Amplification is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (choose when you select this feat). If the Amplification has a prerequisite of any kind, you can select that Amplification only if you’re a psion who meets the prerequisite. Whenever you gain a level, you can replace the Amplification with another one you are eligible for from the psion class.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Cerebral Control
Details:
Your mental fortitude is strong. When you are the target of a psionic ability, you can choose to amplify or dampen the creature’s capabilities.
- You may use your reaction to add or subtract half your Intelligence modifier from an attack, saving throw, or ability check that is psionic in nature where you are the target. 
- You have resistance to psychic damage.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Energy Siphon
Details: You’ve found a way to transmute energy from powerful attacks into the natural healing capabilities of your body. When you score a critical hit, you can spend one Hit Die to heal yourself. Roll the die, add half the damage dealt from the critical hit, and regain a number of hit points equal to the total.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Lifeblood Empowerment
Details:
You have learned to psionically control your vitality to empower yourself: 
-  Increase your Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- When you hit with an attack, you can spend one or more of your Hit Dice to increase the damage of the attack. Roll the Hit Dice and add your Constitution modifier to it. You take this much necrotic damage, which can’t be reduced in any way. The attack gains a bonus to the damage equal to twice the necrotic damage you took. 
- When you cast a spell of 1st through 5th level, you can spend a number of Hit Dice equal to the spell slot spent. When you do, you cast the spell as though it was cast one level higher. You take necrotic damage equal to twice the number of Hit Dice spent, which can’t be reduced in any way.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Mental Movement
Details:
You learn to amplify your Force Move in different ways, granting you the following benefits. 
-  Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- You can cast the Gust of Wind spell, requiring no spell slot or components, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. Your spellcasting ability for the spell is the ability increased by this feat. If you have spell slots of 2nd level or higher, you can cast this spell with them. 
- When a creature provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to use Force Move on that creature, rather than making an opportunity attack.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Prerequisite: The ability to use Force Move
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Mental Protection
Details:
Your psionic abilities have strengthened in power, granting you the following benefits: 
- Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- You learn the Psionic Aegis spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the abjuration or transmutation school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can’t cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spell’s spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Quickdraw
Details: Your psionic senses are so tuned that you process and react faster than most. When you roll initiative, if you aren’t surprised, you can immediately make one attack as a reaction. If your initiative roll is higher than your target’s, you gain a bonus to the damage roll equal to your initiative bonus (minimum of +1).
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Sanguine Harvest
Details: You have limited control over other creatures’ blood. Once per turn, when you reduce a Medium or larger creature that has blood to 0 hit points, you regain one Hit Dice.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Temporal Leap
Details:
You have learned how to briefly jump through time. 
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- When you are damaged by an attack, spell, or other harmful effect, you can use a reaction to instantly teleport out of the current timeline and avoid taking the damage. You vanish, and reappear at the beginning of your next turn in the same space, or the nearest unoccupied space of your choice. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Vitakinesis
Details:
You can accelerate a creature’s natural healing: 
- You gain proficiency in medicine. If you already have proficiency, you gain expertise instead. 
- Whenever a creature within 5 feet of you spends a Hit Die to heal themselves, you can use your reaction to increase the number of hit points they regain by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: none

Name: Psychoportation Initiate
Details:
You are able to begin to blend combat and teleportation to seamlessly move across the battlefield:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- Once on each of your turns, when you attack a creature, you may teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you that you can see. You may do this before or after the attack. This does not cost you any of your movement.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: The apparition assassin path weaves teleportation into the act of attacking with martial or magical means. This path is ideal for those who seek to combine the tactical advantages of teleportation with their combat prowess.

Name: Disorienting Entrance
Details:
Your teleportation gives you the jump on your foes:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- Psychoportation Initiate’s teleport distance increases to 10 feet. 
- You gain advantage on the first attack you make after teleporting.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: The apparition assassin path weaves teleportation into the act of attacking with martial or magical means. This path is ideal for those who seek to combine the tactical advantages of teleportation with their combat prowess.

Name: Lost in Motion
Details:
Your teleportation has become not only a means of locomotion but also of concealment:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- Psychoportation Initiate’s teleport distance increases to 15 feet. 
- You can use a bonus action to take the Hide action, even if you are in plain sight, if you teleported this turn.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: The apparition assassin path weaves teleportation into the act of attacking with martial or magical means. This path is ideal for those who seek to combine the tactical advantages of teleportation with their combat prowess.

Name: Lingering Protection
Details:
Your power to teleport leaves behind residual energy, giving you a defensive boost:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- Psychoportation Initiate’s teleport distance increases to 20 feet. 
- Psionic energy clings to you after you teleport, granting you temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: The apparition assassin path weaves teleportation into the act of attacking with martial or magical means. This path is ideal for those who seek to combine the tactical advantages of teleportation with their combat prowess.

Name: Opportune Strike
Details:
Your expertise in teleportation lets you deliver devastating blows: 
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- Psychoportation Initiate’s teleport distance increases to 25 feet.
- Once per turn, when you score a critical hit against a creature, you can choose to teleport up to 25 feet and make an attack against a target within range.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: The apparition assassin path weaves teleportation into the act of attacking with martial or magical means. This path is ideal for those who seek to combine the tactical advantages of teleportation with their combat prowess.

Name: Novice Artisan
Details:
Your first step on your journey to becoming a master artisan:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
- You reduce the time and material costs to create or repair objects with your tools by 10%. 
- You gain proficiency with one tool of your choice. 
- You learn the Mending cantrip. You can cast it without verbal, somatic, or material components. If you already know this spell, its range increases to 30 feet when you cast it. Its spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: In the artisan path, psionic abilities manifest through heightened focus, granting unparalleled precision, efficiency, and creativity. Through the fusion of mental prowess and craftsmanship, psionic artisans can create masterpieces that transcend traditional limits.

Name: Apprentice Artisan
Details:
You have begun to specialize and gained the knowledge to appraise the work of others:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- You reduce the time and material costs to create or repair objects with your tools by 20%. 
- You gain expertise with one tool of your choice. 
- You learn the Identify spell. You can cast this spell without expending a spell slot or requiring any components. Once you cast Identify in this way, you can’t cast it in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast this spell using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spell’s spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: In the artisan path, psionic abilities manifest through heightened focus, granting unparalleled precision, efficiency, and creativity. Through the fusion of mental prowess and craftsmanship, psionic artisans can create masterpieces that transcend traditional limits.

Name: Journeyman Artisan
Details:
You have a limited ability to imbue your creations with minor psionic properties: 
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- You reduce the time and material costs to create or repair objects with your tools by 30%. 
- You gain the following ability:
Psionic Tinkering. With one hour of work you can imbue items with one or more of the following properties of your choice, which last indefinitely:
Astral Escape. A creature can activate this property as a reaction when it is about to take psychic damage, allowing the creature to separate its consciousness from its physical body and gain resistance to psychic damage until the beginning of its turn at which point the creature reverts to its previous state. 
Precognition Reinforcement. A creature can activate this property as a reaction when needing to make a concentration check, allowing the creature to add half its Intelligence modifier to a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration. 
Pyrokinesis Modulation. An object imbued with this property modulates the heat around it, maintaining a comfortable temperature within 10 feet, regardless of the environment.
Telekinetic Anchor. A creature can activate this property as a reaction when being moved, anchoring the object in place until the beginning of the creature’s turn and giving anyone holding the object advantage on saving throws to resist being moved. 

The maximum number of properties you can bestow is equal to your proficiency bonus. These properties can be distributed among multiple objects. If you exceed the maximum number of properties, the oldest property immediately ends, and then the new property applies.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: In the artisan path, psionic abilities manifest through heightened focus, granting unparalleled precision, efficiency, and creativity. Through the fusion of mental prowess and craftsmanship, psionic artisans can create masterpieces that transcend traditional limits.

Name: Adept Artisan
Details:
Your abilities with your tools has reached new heights:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- You reduce the time and material costs to create or repair objects with your tools by 40%. 
- You have advantage with all ability checks you make with tools with which you are proficient. 
- You learn the Fabricate spell. You can cast this spell without expending a spell slot or requiring any components. Once you cast Fabricate in this way, you can’t cast it in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast this spell using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spell’s spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: In the artisan path, psionic abilities manifest through heightened focus, granting unparalleled precision, efficiency, and creativity. Through the fusion of mental prowess and craftsmanship, psionic artisans can create masterpieces that transcend traditional limits.

Name: Master Artisan
Details:
You are renowned for your work and sought for high-profile commissions:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- You reduce the time and material costs to create or repair objects with your tools by 50%. 
- Whenever you have advantage on an ability check with one of your tools, you can reroll one of the dice once. 
- You have developed a signature crafting style, which increases the value of your creations by 100%.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: In the artisan path, psionic abilities manifest through heightened focus, granting unparalleled precision, efficiency, and creativity. Through the fusion of mental prowess and craftsmanship, psionic artisans can create masterpieces that transcend traditional limits.

Name: Cascading River
Details:
Like the relentless flow of a river, the force you generate is empowered while the rejuvenating effects of the water bestows a soothing energy on those of your choosing:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- Your unarmed strikes gain a +1 bonus to damage rolls. 
- Each feat in this path unlocks an option you can choose to use as an action:
Cascading River. You choose to let a calming presence come over you. Others can sense this state of tranquility and quiet inner resolve. You and a number of creatures of your choice equal to your proficiency bonus within 10 feet gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus (no action required). Once you use this ability, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: Those who follow the centered fist path epitomize the harmony of mind and body, drawing on internal balance to enhance both physical and mental capabilities. Practitioners of this path learn to channel their focus to enhance their combat skills and mental acuity through disciplined meditation.

Name: Dancing Willow
Details:
You learn the intricate dance of gracefully absorbing incoming force: 
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
- When you are hit with a weapon attack, you can use your reaction to decrease the damage it deals by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus. You gain advantage on your next attack against the creature. You can use this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. 
Dancing Willow. You choose to let your consciousness expand and encompass the surrounding environment (no action required). You have advantage on ability checks you make for the next 10 minutes. Once you use this ability, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: Those who follow the centered fist path epitomize the harmony of mind and body, drawing on internal balance to enhance both physical and mental capabilities. Practitioners of this path learn to channel their focus to enhance their combat skills and mental acuity through disciplined meditation.

Name: Bent Sapling
Details:
Emulating the resilience of a sapling in the wind, you bend but do not break: 
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- When a creature within your reach misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to move up to half your movement, which does not provoke an opportunity attack from that creature. 
Bent Sapling. You choose to project yourself into the border regions of Ethereal Plane where it overlaps with your current plane (no action required). You can see and hear the plane you originated from, but everything there looks gray, and you can’t see anything more than 60-feet away. While on the Ethereal Plane, you can only affect and be affected by other creatures on that plane. Creatures that aren’t on the Ethereal Plane can’t perceive you and can’t interact with you, unless a special ability or magic has given them the ability to do so. You remain in the Border Ethereal for the duration or until you use your action to return to your plane of origination. You return to the space you originally projected yourself from. If you occupy the same spot as a solid object or creature when this happens, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space that you can occupy and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved. Once you use this ability, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: Those who follow the centered fist path epitomize the harmony of mind and body, drawing on internal balance to enhance both physical and mental capabilities. Practitioners of this path learn to channel their focus to enhance their combat skills and mental acuity through disciplined meditation.

Name: Rolling Boulder
Details:
Once you start moving, you are hard to stop with physical or illusory barriers: 
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, and you deal more damage than is necessary to reduce that creature to 0 hit points, you may choose to deal the remaining damage to a different creature within your reach. 
Rolling Boulder. You choose to embody the unstoppable momentum of a rolling boulder and your sight smashes through illusory obstacles. You can choose to view through your third eye, gaining truesight out to 120 feet for 10 minutes (no action required). Once you use this ability, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: Those who follow the centered fist path epitomize the harmony of mind and body, drawing on internal balance to enhance both physical and mental capabilities. Practitioners of this path learn to channel their focus to enhance their combat skills and mental acuity through disciplined meditation.

Name: Falling Acorn
Details:
Recognizing and tapping into potential energy, you work with the forces around you to increase your damage and an ally’s capabilities: 
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- For each 5 feet you fall before delivering an unarmed strike, add 1d4 to the damage dealt. Falling more than 5 feet times your level does not increase the damage further. 
Falling Acorn. You choose to temporarily awaken the latent potential of another creature within 30 feet of you that you can see (no action required). For the next 10 minutes, the creature has a bonus on attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks equal to your proficiency bonus. Once you use this ability, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: Those who follow the centered fist path epitomize the harmony of mind and body, drawing on internal balance to enhance both physical and mental capabilities. Practitioners of this path learn to channel their focus to enhance their combat skills and mental acuity through disciplined meditation.

Name: Elemental Prime
Details:
You begin to master control over a specific elemental energy:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
- Choose one damage type from acid, fire, cold, lightning, or thunder. You gain resistance to that damage type and use this type in subsequent feats in this path.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: The elemental conduit path applies psionic control to an element. The journey transforms the individual into a living conduit of this energy, providing some measure of control over the previously volatile and untamed natural force.

Name: Elemental Adept
Details:
The elemental power coursing through your body lashes out at your enemies:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- Once per turn, you deal an extra 1d6 damage of the damage type you selected to one creature you hit with an attack.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: The elemental conduit path applies psionic control to an element. The journey transforms the individual into a living conduit of this energy, providing some measure of control over the previously volatile and untamed natural force.

Name: Elemental Retribution
Details:
You unleash elemental fury upon those who harm you:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- When a creature’s damage drops you below half your hit points, you can use a reaction to deal 1d6 damage of the damage type you selected to that creature. In addition, all attacks against that creature before the end of your next turn are made with advantage. Once you use this ability, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: The elemental conduit path applies psionic control to an element. The journey transforms the individual into a living conduit of this energy, providing some measure of control over the previously volatile and untamed natural force.

Name: Elemental Weakness
Details:
Your power over your chosen element can damage those within close proximity:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- When a creature that doesn’t have all its hit points moves, or starts it turn, within 5 feet of you, you can choose to deal 1d6 damage of the damage type you selected to that creature.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: The elemental conduit path applies psionic control to an element. The journey transforms the individual into a living conduit of this energy, providing some measure of control over the previously volatile and untamed natural force.

Name: Elemental Mastery
Details:
You master control over your element:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
- You gain immunity to your chosen damage type. 
- Whenever you take damage of your chosen type, you regain hit points instead equal to the damage dealt. Once you’ve regained a number of hit points equal to your level, the ability ceases to function until you finish a long rest.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: The elemental conduit path applies psionic control to an element. The journey transforms the individual into a living conduit of this energy, providing some measure of control over the previously volatile and untamed natural force.

Name: Calming Presence
Details:
You harness your own tranquility to diffuse tensions around you:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- You learn the Calm Emotions spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the enchantment school of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can’t cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells’ spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: The peacemaker path is for those who seek to mend rifts and foster harmony. The amplified empathy of a psionic is key for focusing on diffusing conflict, understanding emotions, and building consensus.

Name: Empathic Reader
Details:
You can sense people’s inner intentions:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- You gain proficiency in the Insight skill. If you already have proficiency in the Insight skill, you instead gain expertise with that skill.- You have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: The peacemaker path is for those who seek to mend rifts and foster harmony. The amplified empathy of a psionic is key for focusing on diffusing conflict, understanding emotions, and building consensus.

Name: Team Player
Details:
Your assistance and spirit of cooperation bolsters others:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- When you spend one or more Hit Die to regain hit points, a creature of your choice within 5 feet of you regains 2 hit points per Hit Die you spent. 
- When you take the Help action, the target gains temporary hit points and a bonus to its roll equal to your proficiency bonus.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: The peacemaker path is for those who seek to mend rifts and foster harmony. The amplified empathy of a psionic is key for focusing on diffusing conflict, understanding emotions, and building consensus.

Name: Solution Architect
Details:
You craft solutions to complex disputes and problems:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- You have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks. 
- When you use the Help action to aid a creature making a skill check, you can share your proficiency in that skill with the creature for that specific check, provided you are proficient. If you are assisting a creature that is already proficient in that skill, that creature gains expertise when making this skill check.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: The peacemaker path is for those who seek to mend rifts and foster harmony. The amplified empathy of a psionic is key for focusing on diffusing conflict, understanding emotions, and building consensus.

Name: Conflict Resolution
Details:
You see every conflict as an opportunity for resolution:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- When making a Charisma ability check, you can give yourself a bonus equal to your Intelligence or Wisdom modifier. 
- You can use the Help action as a bonus action.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: The peacemaker path is for those who seek to mend rifts and foster harmony. The amplified empathy of a psionic is key for focusing on diffusing conflict, understanding emotions, and building consensus.

Name: Psychography
Details:
You can produce written words, without consciously writing:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- When you take a short or long rest, you subconsciously connect with spirits and other forces around you. At the end of the rest, your notebook has an additional entry in connection with a crime you are solving, puzzle that has you stumped, or other similar cognitively demanding task. This may take many forms such as a sketch, a single letter, or a poem from someone you do not know.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: Your investigative skills have become more effective as you unlock your latent psionic potential.

Name: Retrocognition
Details:
You have developed the ability to witness past events that occurred in your location:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- If you spend 10 minutes stationary in a meditative trance, you can relive past events that occurred within 30 feet of your location. Make an Intelligence (History) check to determine how far into the past you were able to look. Once you have attempted this, you must wait 1 day before attempting again within 1,000 feet of the same location. 

Retrocognition Duration - DC 
- 1 Hour - 15 
- 8 Hours - 20 
- 1 Day - 25 
- 1 Week - 30 
- 1 Month - 35 
- 1 Year - 40
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: Your investigative skills have become more effective as you unlock your latent psionic potential.

Name: Empathic Insight
Details:
You can read the auras of creatures you can see: 
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.  
- You have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks for a creature whose aura you know.  
- All creatures within 30 feet of you project one of the following ten auras:  
Calm. The aura radiates a sense of tranquility or peace.  
Conflicted. The aura radiates a rapidly shifting set of emotions, indicating inner turmoil.  
Deceptive. The aura radiates lies or ulterior motives.
Determined. The aura radiates resolve or determination.
Envious. The aura radiates jealousy or covetousness.  
Fearful. The aura radiates fear or anxiety.  
Hostile. The aura radiates aggression or anger.  
Joyful. The aura radiates happiness or positivity.  
Sad. The aura radiates sorrow or melancholy.  
Suspicious. The aura radiates wariness or doubt.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: Your investigative skills have become more effective as you unlock your latent psionic potential.

Name: True Clarity
Details:
Your psychic abilities help you to see things for what they truly are: 
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.  
- You gain 30 feet of truesight.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: Your investigative skills have become more effective as you unlock your latent psionic potential.

Name: Information Extraction
Details:
You can use your psychic powers to extract information: 
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.  
- You immediately know when a creature whose words you can hear is not speaking the truth and can discern which words were false.  
- You have advantage on all Charisma ability checks.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: Your investigative skills have become more effective as you unlock your latent psionic potential.

Name: Thrall
Details:
As your journey into the vampire’s world begins, you find yourself taking your first step. Dark forces are at work, slowly transforming your mortal body into something more. You sense the changes, the shadows that dance within you, and the allure of the night whispers to your very soul:  
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.  
- You gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, increase the range by 30 feet.  
- You gain the following traits:  
Absence. You no longer have a reflection.  
Aura of Subjugation. When you make a Charisma check, you can attempt to feed on the mind of any creature that can hear you, giving yourself a +1 bonus to the roll and giving them a -1 penalty to their next ability check. A creature immediately recognizes your attempt to influence its mind and may become hostile toward you.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: Whether you were bitten by a vampire, descended from a parent touched by their curse, or drawn into a dark ritual, you now walk the path of the vampire. Embracing the bloodline and psionic enhancements, whether by choice or compulsion, you feel the ancient power coursing through your veins, forever altering your destiny. As you unleash your abilities, waves of cold radiate from your being, your skin pales, your eyes gleam an unnatural silver, and your very presence seems to emit a faint supernatural glow.

Name: Familiar
Details:
Firmly on the path, your body’s transformation is more pronounced, bringing with it additional benefits. The bloodline’s influence and psionic prowess grow, granting you enhanced capabilities that reflect your ever-deepening connection to the vampiric essence:  
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.  
- You gain resistance to necrotic damage.  
- You gain the following traits:  
Vampiric Quirks. You suddenly find garlic repulsive, symbols of faith disturb you greatly, and domestic animals are extremely agitated in your presence.  
Children of the Night. As an action, you can magically call 1d4 swarms of bats. While outdoors, you can call 1d4 wolves instead. The called creatures arrive in 1d4 rounds, acting as allies of you and obeying your spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until you die, or until you dismiss them as a bonus action. You regain the use of this ability when you finish a long rest.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: Whether you were bitten by a vampire, descended from a parent touched by their curse, or drawn into a dark ritual, you now walk the path of the vampire. Embracing the bloodline and psionic enhancements, whether by choice or compulsion, you feel the ancient power coursing through your veins, forever altering your destiny. As you unleash your abilities, waves of cold radiate from your being, your skin pales, your eyes gleam an unnatural silver, and your very presence seems to emit a faint supernatural glow.

Name: Initiate
Details:
Having completed a significant milestone in your transformation, there is no turning back. You stand firmly on the path of the vampire that defines your existence. Your ability to feed on the mental energies of others has become more refined and is now essential for your transformation’s cravings. With this newfound ability comes the first true hindrance, as the darkness within you begins to wrestle with your humanity:  
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.  
- You gain the following traits:  
Forbiddance. You can’t enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.  
Cerebral Detection. As an action, you can attune your psionic senses, honing in on the mental energies given off by any Medium or larger creature with an Intelligence of 8 or greater within 100 feet. You know the location of each of these creatures not behind total cover until the beginning of your next turn.  
Mind Feed. As an action, you target a creature you can see within 30 feet and attempt to feed off of its thoughts and emotions. Make an Intelligence check contested by the creature’s Intelligence check; you have advantage if the target is subject to a condition other than Invisible. On a success, the target takes psychic damage equal to your level and you heal for an amount equal to the damage dealt. In addition, you discern the target’s surface emotions and thoughts. This ability has no effect on a Small or smaller creature with an Intelligence less than 8. This ability’s damage is doubled when successfully used against a creature with an Intelligence of 20 or greater.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: Whether you were bitten by a vampire, descended from a parent touched by their curse, or drawn into a dark ritual, you now walk the path of the vampire. Embracing the bloodline and psionic enhancements, whether by choice or compulsion, you feel the ancient power coursing through your veins, forever altering your destiny. As you unleash your abilities, waves of cold radiate from your being, your skin pales, your eyes gleam an unnatural silver, and your very presence seems to emit a faint supernatural glow.

Name: Spawn
Details:
Drawing closer to the zenith of power, you also unlock an additional hindrance as your vampiric abilities strengthen. Your journey has brought you into the heart of darkness, and you are now more attuned to the supernatural elements that define your existence, enabling you to manipulate the very thoughts and emotions of others:  
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.  
- You gain the following traits:  
Harmed by Running Water. You take 5 acid damage when you start your turn in running water. In addition, holy water becomes an effective weapon against you, damaging you as though you were Undead.  
Bloodlink. You can forge a psionic connection with another creature for the next 10 minutes by using an action to drink its blood, unlocking these additional abilities:  
    a. The creature suffers from disadvantage on any ability checks you compel it to make.  
    b. As an action, you can see through the creature’s eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the creature has. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses.  
    c. If you meditate for 1 minute and focus on the creature’s blood, you can relive the last minute of the creature’s life before the blood was spilled.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: Whether you were bitten by a vampire, descended from a parent touched by their curse, or drawn into a dark ritual, you now walk the path of the vampire. Embracing the bloodline and psionic enhancements, whether by choice or compulsion, you feel the ancient power coursing through your veins, forever altering your destiny. As you unleash your abilities, waves of cold radiate from your being, your skin pales, your eyes gleam an unnatural silver, and your very presence seems to emit a faint supernatural glow.

Name: Nightwalker
Details:
As a master of the night, you move about with relative impunity. However, you remain vulnerable to the one true enemy—the relentless assault of sunlight, which reveals your true nature and diminishes your strength:  
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.  - You gain immunity to necrotic damage.  
- You gain the following traits:  
Sunlight Sensitivity. While in sunlight, you have disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.  
Thought Harvest. Upon a successful Mind Feed Intelligence check, your hunger surges with newfound potency, allowing you to seamlessly redirect your focus to another creature within 30 feet of your original target and immediately initiate the ability once more. Each creature can only be targeted once per round. This relentless harvest of thoughts and emotions continues until you either exhaust all available targets or fail an Intelligence check.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: Whether you were bitten by a vampire, descended from a parent touched by their curse, or drawn into a dark ritual, you now walk the path of the vampire. Embracing the bloodline and psionic enhancements, whether by choice or compulsion, you feel the ancient power coursing through your veins, forever altering your destiny. As you unleash your abilities, waves of cold radiate from your being, your skin pales, your eyes gleam an unnatural silver, and your very presence seems to emit a faint supernatural glow.

Name: Technical Grappler
Details:
Your amplified intellect provides mastery over the fundamentals of grappling:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.  
- You gain proficiency in the Athletics skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise instead.  
- If a creature you are attempting to grapple fails the contested check by 5 or more, you can choose to knock that creature prone.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: While many psionic capabilities are used on external sources, those following the wrestler path have chosen to amplify their own physical capabilities to outmaneuver and overpower their opponents.

Name: Bone Crusher
Details:
Your psionically amplified strength and agility is not only enough to grapple larger creatures, but strong enough to crush those wrapped in your python-like embrace: 
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.  
- You can grapple creatures up to two sizes larger than yourself. 
- When you are grappling a creature, you can choose to deal bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier whenever that creature fails a contested grappling check against you.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: While many psionic capabilities are used on external sources, those following the wrestler path have chosen to amplify their own physical capabilities to outmaneuver and overpower their opponents.

Name: Embrace Attacker
Details:
You have learned to embrace every opportunity that presents itself: 
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.  
- When you are attacked by a creature within your reach, you can attempt to grapple the creature as a reaction.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: While many psionic capabilities are used on external sources, those following the wrestler path have chosen to amplify their own physical capabilities to outmaneuver and overpower their opponents.

Name: High-Flying Maneuvers
Details:
Your ability to outmaneuver your opponent leaves them few options: 
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.  
- Any subsequent grapple check against a target you are already grappling is made with advantage.  
- If you succeed on two grapple checks in a row against the same target, the target is also restrained until the grapple breaks.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: While many psionic capabilities are used on external sources, those following the wrestler path have chosen to amplify their own physical capabilities to outmaneuver and overpower their opponents.

Name: Body Shield
Details:
Your control over your grappled opponents is unmatched: 
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20. 
- When you are grappling a creature and another creature attacks you, you can use your reaction to make the creature you are grappling the target of the other creature’s attack.
Source: Creed's Codex: Legend of the Psions
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: While many psionic capabilities are used on external sources, those following the wrestler path have chosen to amplify their own physical capabilities to outmaneuver and overpower their opponents.

Name: Enlightened Companion
Details:
Your companion has more defensive capabilities and picks up additional traits:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
- Your companion’s hit points are equal to 4 + three times your level, rather than 4 + two times your level.
- Your companion’s size becomes Large.
- Your companion gains the following traits:
Illuminated. Your companion can shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet if you choose for it to be illuminated.
Pack Tactics. Your companion has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.
Source: Creed's Codex: Arcane Secrets of the Summoners
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: The Companion Caller path allows you to summon and empower a creature you’ve manifested from your will.

Name: Manifest Companion
Details:
You can summon one of the following companions over a minute by spending a Hit Die and focusing your will on the creature you want to bring forth. The companion appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. The creature is friendly to you and your companions and obeys your commands. Choose its stat block: 	
- Aberration Companion
- Celestial Companion
- Elemental Companion
- Undead Companion

In combat, your companion acts during your turn. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes is the Dodge action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are incapacitated, the companion is also incapacitated.

When you finish a long rest, you regain the use of this ability. If you already have a companion manifested from this feature, it vanishes when a new companion is summoned. The companion also vanishes if you die.
Source: Creed's Codex: Arcane Secrets of the Summoners
Ability Score Increase: none
Feat Path details: The Companion Caller path allows you to summon and empower a creature you’ve manifested from your will.

Name: Proficient Companion
Details:
You’ve found ways to amplify your will to empower your companion further: 
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
- When you use Manifest Companion, you can give your companion one additional speed of 30 feet: climbing, flying, burrowing, or swimming.
- You can add your proficiency bonus to your companion’s AC, damage rolls, and saving throws.
- Your companion’s size becomes Medium.
Source: Creed's Codex: Arcane Secrets of the Summoners
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: The Companion Caller path allows you to summon and empower a creature you’ve manifested from your will.

Name: Conqueror Companion
Details:
Your companion has grown to terrifying proportions:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
- When you command your companion to take the Attack action, the companion uses its Frightful Presence. It then makes two attacks.
- Your companion’s size becomes Huge.
- Your companion gains the following traits:
Frightful Presence. Each creature of the companion’s choice that is within 120 feet of the companion and aware of it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to 10 + PB) or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the companion’s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.
Siege Monster. The companion deals double damage to objects and structures.
Source: Creed's Codex: Arcane Secrets of the Summoners
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: The Companion Caller path allows you to summon and empower a creature you’ve manifested from your will.

Name: Revive Companion
Details:
You have mastered a way to bring forth your companion more frequently at the cost of your own vitality:
- Increase one ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
- The companion’s melee weapon attack range increases by 10 feet, and its ranged weapon attack range increases by 60 feet.
- Your companion’s size becomes Gargantuan.
- You gain the Revive Companion feature:
Revive Companion. If the companion has died within the last hour, you can use your action to touch it and expend a Hit Die. The companion returns to life after 1 minute with all its hit points restored.
Source: Creed's Codex: Arcane Secrets of the Summoners
Ability Score Increase: "One ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20"
Feat Path details: The Companion Caller path allows you to summon and empower a creature you’ve manifested from your will.
